Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: colored drawing of a chapel scene

The surface of the canvas has been marked in colored pencils to depict a Chapel scene. The main figures are a large stocky badger, a large well-muscled tiger, a slim scar-covered panther, a tall broad-shouldered panther and a gangly lemur. The badger clad in Avoirdupois uniform leans heavily into the tiger's torso; the same tiger wearing the sunset orange cloak representing Paladins of the Church. The broad-shouldered panther wearing smart smokey grey and silver clothing appears to be aiding the tiger in securing the badger, though slight strain is revealed by the crease of his brow and tightening around the eyes. Standing tall and imposing, the scar-covered panther holds high a vial filled with pink liquid, with his cruel lips parted in the process of speaking. He carries in one hand a tall quarterstaff inlayed with gems; it appears to have been crafted from bone, with matching bone prayer beads secured into the belt of his blood-red cassock. Elsewhere, the lemur hunches over a silver plate with a number of mysterious symbols upon its surface, all unreadable and intentionally obscured by the artist. The contents of the plate - a green myrtle branch and purple swampweed - create a blue smoke as they burn. The same smoke curls ethereally around the figures and towards the front of the page, causing the legs to progressively fade into nothing. The lemur wears a cassock similar to the scar-covered panther, its only difference being that it is coloured light yellow hemp. Most striking of all is where every set of eyes are focused; a wispy spirit in the shape of a vixen hovers above the unconscious badger with her expression set into that of an open-mouthed shriek. Threads of the spirits streak towards the silver plate, as if some unseen force is dragging it from the badger and into the object. Overall, the colours are bright and detailed, with an overlap of misty blue pencil. In a portion of smoke to the bottom, right-hand corner is the signature Una; the 'U' is turned upside-down, and dotted with eyes in imitation of a frowny face.
